Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a set of images that have been taken out of context and falsely attributed to a recent event.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Devendra Fadnavis visited a mazar (shrine) after resigning as the Chief Minister, which is not supported by any evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the images are from a completely different event, the death anniversary of Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin in 2015.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance and intention of the visit by suggesting that it indicates danger to Hindus and a betrayal by Fadnavis.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting false information and misleading interpretations of the images.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the images are from a past event and have no connection to Fadnavis visiting a mazar after the Maharashtra elections.
